content.webTitle: Nortel pays $2.5bn to settle accounts scandal

fields.headline: Nortel pays $2.5bn to settle accounts scandal
fields.bodyText: Nortel Networks yesterday agreed to pay almost $2.5bn (£1.4bn) in cash and shares to settle two class-action lawsuits stemming from a long-running $3.2bn financial scandal. The telecommunications equipment maker had to restate several years of profits and fired ten senior executives including former chief Frank Dunn in April 2004. The Canadian company is paying $575m in cash plus shares equivalent to 14.5% of its equity, although it hopes to recover some cash in lawsuits against its former bosses. Nortel is still the subject of regulatory and criminal investigations.
